alert.note: Alert for Gregg; Smith; Upshur (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 6:48PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Smith, south central Upshur and northwestern Gregg Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 648 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gladewater, moving northeast at 10 mph. Another strong thunderstorm was indicated over East Mountain, also moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Longview, White Oak, Gladewater, Clarksville City, East Mountain, West Mountain, Liberty City, Union Grove, Warren City and Judson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
